ETYMOLOGY: From French centimètre, from Latin centum 'hundred' + Ancient Greek metron 'measure'. First defined in the French metric system.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A unit of length in the metric system, equal to one hundredth of a metre (0.01 metres). (American English spelling: centimeter)
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 公制长度单位，等于一米的百分之一（0.01米）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The caterpillar was only about two centimetres long.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这条毛毛虫只有大约两厘米长。

REGISTER: Used commonly in everyday measurements, science, engineering, and international contexts.
